attributes.comment:
To whom this may concern:

I am adopting from Vietnam and have always thought that these application fees
are unreasonably high. Now there is a proposed increase???
Why does it cost $500 and up for an application of orphan status petition?
1.What is the work involved in approving these papers that can JUSTIFY the cost?
I think the thinking behind this is that adoption is already expensive,
prospective parents who want their children home would not mind another few
hundreds dollars?
But that is putting an unnecessary and unfair burden on adopting parents, they
already have to save and spare everything they could to adopt a kid. And the
government not only NOT making it easier, it's making harder for good people
trying to do good things in their lives. If anything, these cost should be
reduced, not increased.

2.Why the expiration of fingerprints and applications? Do you know what is the
average wait for China or Vietnam adoption? And the wait is only getting
longer, that means many of these prospective parents will have to pay these high
fees twice, that means the cost will be THOUSANDS just for these petition
papers. Why don't you have a proposal for cutting the fees in half for the
second or update/renew application?

A prospective adopting parent,

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by T
